workout_file.description: Tempo training: The goal of this training is to spend time in Zone 3 at an intensity where the use of sugar and fats as fuel is equal. Time spent in this zone increases muscle glycogen storages.
workout_file.name: Week 3.4 - Tempo

textevent.message: We have another tempo day in store for today's workout!
Let's start with a nice warmup to get the legs moving and the blood flowing.
3mins into it, hopefully the pedalstroke is feeling a bit more fluid now.
That's halfway. Let's chat a little bit about what's in store for today.
The goal of this training is to spend time in Zone 3 at an intensity where the use of sugar and fats as fuel is equal.
Time spent in this zone increases muscle glycogen storages.
The goal for today will be to further progress our tempo workout from last week.
We'll work with a similar approach to last week with multiple 4, and 6min intervals, with a finale of 4, 1min intervals at FTP.
2mins to go, then we'll go directly into our first tempo effort.
The first 4 intervals are 4mins, at 88% FTP, with 2mins recovery between.
Let's aim for a comfortable cadence for these first 4 intervals as well.
All right, ready for a bit more effort? Remember, comfortable cadence for these intervals.
Nice and steady here. Use this first minute to adjust to the increased effort.
Great work! Now, Let's aim to keep things smooth and consistent for the next 3mins.
How does your form look? Shoulder relaxed? Elbows bent slightly? Light grip on the bars?
Awesome! That's 1 down, and 3 more to go. We'll take a couple of minutes really easy now.
Take a few sips of fluid during these rest breaks, and spin out legs.
Here we go with our 2nd interval! Same idea here, start off comfortable and keep smooth.
That's halfway through this interval. You should feel well in control here, keep at it!
Awesome work! 2 down, 2 to go. Let's spin the legs out again here and take a few sips of fluid.
Back on again! We're over the halfway point now with this first set of intervals :-)
88% FTP can be considered the low end of sweet spot (SST), and has been shown to be great bang for the buck.
One of the keys with SST training, and FTP training generally, is progressive overload.
This is why each week of this plan is just slightly more challenging than the last.
Beautiful work so far! We only have 1 more interval to go. Let's take 2mins easy here.
Okay, finale of these 4min intervals. Let's make this one just as good as the first 3!
Are your legs feeling as good as the first interval? Having some fatigue is normal at this point.
But, this effort should still feel quite doable for you.
Last minute! Keep that cadence up, don't let it drop if you're fatigued!
Great work! That's the first set of intervals complete! Let's take a 4min rest now before we move on.
Keep things nice and easy still here. That's 16mins of zone 3 in the books so far today :-).
Our next interval set consists of 3 intervals. Each interval is broken down into 2, 3min portions.
For the first 3min portion, I want your cadence to be 90 RPM, and for the second portion, 100 RPM.
The interval intensity will also change slightly every 3mins between 83% and 89% FTP.
Ready? Remember, 90 RPM to start these off.
We're starting off at 86% FTP here, then moving up to 89% in 3mins.
Use this first minute to adjust again.
We're halfway through this first portion now. Make sure you're staying honest with the cadence.
In 30sec, we're going to lift both the cadence and power. Cadence up to 100 RPM, and power up to 89% FTP.
Let's put the work in here! Higher cadence and more watts for these next 3mins!
Don't lose your form here, and I don't want to see any bouncing in the saddle!
Final 30sec! Keep pushing all the way to the arch now!
Excellent work! Now we take 3mins easy. Deep breaths here.
Same rule applies here too, keep drinking! You should be finishing approx. 1 bottle/hour indoors.
In 30sec, we're back to work! This time we're starting at the higher power.
Aim for 90 RPM to start again. Settle into the rhythm quickly.
89% FTP should take concentration and feel like work, but you shouldn't be all out here.
Up next, we're going to drop the power, but lift the cadence to 100 RPM!
Pick up the cadence! I want FAST FEET, but no bouncing in the saddle.
Halfway through! Keep your form rock solid and those hips planted on the saddle.
Just 30sec left! Spin those legs!
Perfect! 3mins nice and easy again here, then we'll do that 1 more time :-)
All right, the last of these intervals is going to be low, then high power again.
Get to 90 RPM quickly and keep the leg turnover nice and consistent.
Your legs should be feeling somewhat fatigued by this point, keep going!
30sec left here, then we're lifting both power and cadence to finish it up!
Let's go! Higher power and faster cadence! Get the work done here!
Halfway through! C'mon!
Push it all the way to the arch!
Great work with those intervals! We just have 1 interval set left for today, then we're done!
Let's take a few minutes easy first though :-)
Our final set of interval set consists of 4, 1min intervals at FTP.
I want a fast cadence for these again, and we're going to aim for 100 RPM during the work interval.
And we'll have 3mins easy between intervals. Sound like a plan?!
Okay, start spinning those legs up to 100 RPM and let's get into our last interval set!
HIT IT! Big power here and fast cadence!
Halfway through, don't let that cadence drop off now!
Awesome! That's 1 down, 3 to go. We have a nice long 3min recovery between these.
Start spinning those legs up again...
GO GO GO! Get those legs moving!
C'mon now! Keep the cadence up, don't falter now!
Nice and easy again now...2 more to go :-)
HIT IT! Really attack this minute and squeeze what's left out of those legs!
Try to hit 103 RPM for these last 30sec! PUSH IT!
Woo! You're doing so well here. We just have 2 more intervals to go, and we wrap this up!
Ready to rock this one? Start spinning those legs up...
And, GO GO GO!
PUSH IT! High cadence from start to finish!
Get to the arch!
DONE! Just 1 more to go, then we start our cool down.
1min to go, then we finish our final effort today. Take a few deep breaths here.
All right, start spinning the legs up to 100 RPM again...
UP UP UP!
Halfway done! Push the cadence up even higher if you can here! GO GO GO!
Yeah! Nice work today, my friend! Let's take a few minutes nice and easy, then we'll start cooling down.
Let's keep the legs spinning for another few minutes, then we check this workout off!
That was a hard effort today, but very high quality and perfect for raising your FTP.
Enjoy the last couple of minutes, and we'll see you next time!
